Articles.Content:
Salutations, soldiers.

If you are here, it means you are a member of the R.K.M. in the Orbital Division. If you are not, enlist now or leave.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it:

OBJECTIVE: Orbit three different satellites and rendezvous with at least one.

REWARD: An upgrade to your rank, shown with a change to your roster and signature

DEADLINE: Zero-hundred hours on the fifteenth day of the first month in the twelfth year of the first decade of the first century of the second millennium

Orbit means, place in orbit?

Sounds plausible. Too bad I\'m on a vacation right now :\'(

Orbit means, place in orbit?

Sounds plausible. Too bad I\'m on a vacation right now :\'(

Oooh, where?

Orbit means, place in orbit?

Sounds plausible. Too bad I\'m on a vacation right now :\'(

What? A vacation is good, why do you cry about it?

What? A vacation is good, why do you cry about it?

Nevermind that, I know how to make things work through now

@OP, in my province, somewhere in Phils.

@topic, practicing for the challenge now 8) might capture a video of it
I only have a few days till I\'m on vacation too. I will give it a crack

Tried it with the Same KerbalComm3. Just attached a couple of flares to the payloads. Dropped the 3 satellites in KSO 120 degrees from each other, then moved 120 degrees again and found the first one (I made 1 more orbit than it). During approach 1 engaged 5x timewarp, then returned to 1x and the satellite disappeared! (found it on my side teared apart - at least the flares flied separately).

Science department proposes to launch an experimental platform for researching the teleportation effect.

I\'ll post the video a bit later.

Here is it. Rather messy approach, but when I got normal trajectory something happened...

Been doing dry runs with my SatLayerXpress, with 3 NovaPunch satellites as payload.

Hauling them in orbit is a piece of cake, but the rendezvous...

Hauling them in orbit is a piece of cake, but the rendezvous...

Answer = Stationary Satellites

You will find it where you let it

And something for the final approach:

Relative velocity = Surface speed 8)

THE KOLD WAR IS OVER!

The R.K.M wins 36-14!

Congratulations to NuttyTecc for winning the contest! Expect your medal within the week.
